Class Plot

[line 50]

Location: /PlotClass/plot.class.php




Remarks


Class used to draw plots


Class containing functions to draw plots to an image.

	
usedby

		
RenderWikiPlot()

	
copyright

		
Copyright 2006, WikiPlot development team.

	
author

		
WikiPlot development team.

	
license

Inherited Method Summary
 







Method Detail



    



    Plot::DisplayPlot
    


    
DisplayPlot(
[string
$DisplayType = "png"], [ImageResource
$ImageResource = null], [Boolean
$ChangeSize = false] );

    



		
    Parameters
    
			
    $DisplayType
    
		
    Type of image to view (png|jpeg|gif).
    
			
    $ImageResource
    
		
    Defaults to null, will generate empty ImageResource.
    
			
    $ChangeSize
    
		
    May we change the size of the plot to fit given ImageResource?
    
		
    Remarks
    

    Display plot as image
    

    Displays plot as image on the page. This makes current http-request return an image. You can set the DisplayType to png, gif or jpeg. Defaults to png, gif not recommanded. Note: this changes the current http-request mimetype to the respective image mimetype.
    
	
    uses
    
		
    Plot::GeneratePlot()
    
	
    access
    
		
    public
    
	
    [ Top ]

    Plot::GetCoordinatX
    


    
GetCoordinatX(
integer
$x );

    



		
    Parameters
    
			
    $x
    
		
    X image coordinat to be converted.
    
			
    Returns
    
		
    Coordiante space representation given parameter.
    

    Remarks
    

    Convert to coordinate space
    

    Converts an x image position to x coordinate position. Coordinate space may differ from Image space, if Width!= (MaxX-MinX).

 );

    Plot::GetYGridSpace
    


    
GetYGridSpace(
 );

    



		
    Returns
    
		
    The space between grid on y axes.
    

    Remarks
    

    Get Y grid space
    

    Returns Y grid space, either calculated or from given value if given one. If it is to be calculated, it is calculated the same way as x axes!
    
	
    usedby
    
		
    Plot::DrawYGrid()
    
	
    uses
    
		
    Plot::$YGridSpace
    
	
    access
    
		
    private
    
	
    [ Top ]
    

    



    Plot::SaveAs
    


    
SaveAs(
string
$Path, [string
$SaveAs = "png"], [ImageResource
$ImageResource = null], [Boolean
$ChangeSize = false] );

    



		
    Parameters
    
			
    $Path
    
		
    Path of file to save.
    
			
    $SaveAs
    
		
    Filetype definition (png|jpeg|gif).
    
			
    $ImageResource
    
		
    Defaults to null, will generate empty ImageResource.
    
			
    $ChangeSize
    
		
    May we change the size of the plot to fit given ImageResource?
    
		
    Remarks
    

    Save plot to image
    

    Saves the plot to an image. You can set the SaveAs to a file type: png, gif or jpeg, defaults to png.
    
	
    uses
    
		
    Plot::GeneratePlot()
    
	
    access
    
		
    public
    
	
    [ Top ]
    

    



    Plot::ShortNumber
    


    
ShortNumber(
integer
$Number, [integer
$MaxLen = 7] );

    



		
    Parameters
    
			
    $Number
    
		
    The number you wish to shorten.
    
			
    $MaxLen
    
		
    The maximum length of the output default to 7.
    
			
    Returns
    
		
    Scientific notation of the given Number at a certain length.
    

    Remarks
    

    Generates short numbers
    

    Rewrites numbers into scientific notation, with a certain maximum length.
     Example: ShortNumber(501000000) == 5.01e8
    
	
    usedby
    
		
    Plot::DrawYGrid()
    
	
    usedby
    
		
    Plot::DrawXGrid()
    
	
    access
    
		
    private
    
	
    [ Top ]

  • $Caption =  null [line 73]
    • 

  • Data type: string
    • 


    Remarks
    

    Caption of the plot
    

    Caption of the plot, will be shown as text centered on the final plot.  Leave this variable as null if no Caption is wanted.

  • $GridColor = array(240,240,240) [line 196]
    • 

  • Data type: array
    • 


    Remarks
    

    Grid color
    

    Defaults to gray, and determains the color of the grid. This is an array of three integers, one for red, green and blue. Where integeres has values between 0 and 255.  

    1      var $Red = 240;
    2      var $Green = 240;
    3      var $Blue = 240;
    4      $this->GridColor = array($Red,$Green,$Blue);
    
	
    usedby
    
		
    Plot::DrawYGrid()
    
	
    usedby
    
		
    Plot::DrawXGrid()
    
	
    usedby
    
		
    Plot::GetHash()
    
	
    see
    
		
    Plot::DrawGrid()
    
	
    access
    
		
    public

  • $MaxX =  100 [line 133]
    • 

  • Data type: integer
    • 


    Remarks
    

    Maximum X
    

    Maximum X in coordinate space.  Together with MinX this variable defines width of the plot in coordinate space.  This width may differ from width of the image, the coordinate will be scaled correctly.
    
	
    usedby
    
		
    Plot::DrawAxis()
    
	
    usedby
    
		
    Plot::GetCoordinatX()
    
	
    usedby

  • $MaxY =  100 [line 159]
    • 

  • Data type: integer
    • 


    Remarks
    

    Maximum Y
    

    Maximum Y in coordinate space.  Together with MinY this variable defines height of the plot in coordinate space.  This height may differ from height of the image, the coordinate will be scaled correctly.
    
	
    usedby
    
		
    Plot::DrawAxis()
    
	
    usedby
